snippet: Of the crises facing American troops today, suicide ranks among the most emotionally wrenching — and confounding.
abstract: Suicide among soldiers is rising steadily, one of the most emotionally wrenching and confounding crises facing American troops today; record 350 suicides occurred in 2012 alone, twice as many as previous decade and surpassing number of American troops killed in Afghanistan; military experts have little explanation for disturbing trend.

byline.original: By JAMES DAO and ANDREW W. LEHREN

lead_paragraph: Of the crises facing American troops today, suicide ranks among the most emotionally wrenching — and confounding.

headline.seo: Baffling Rise in Suicides Plagues U.S. Military
headline.main: Baffling Rise in Suicides Plagues the U.S. Military
headline.print_headline: Baffling Rise in Suicides Plagues U.S. Military

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
